result.execSummary:
The defendant Ron E Angelo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA sample and surcharge; Register as sex offender; Comply with treatment plan as recommended; No contact with juveniles under age 18 except in a business or commercial setting or if it does not include overnight there can be contact provided the juvenile is in the presence of the juvenile's parent or guardian. No contact with the victims A.M.A., A.J.A. or A.F.A. unless in the presence of or consent of their mother while they are under age 18 and if they are 18 years of age or older the consent would be at their own discretion.

records.addlTxt:
9:33 am - Defendant Ron E Angelo appeared with attorney David Deda.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewd pre-sentence investigation. Court states he's been provided with letters from Attorney Deda and has received victim impact statements. Comments by Attorney Deda regarding clarification of some comments in PSI. Exam of Agent Singsime by Court.  Response by Singsime. Comments and recommendation by DA. Response by Attorney Deda.  Comments by DE. Attorney Deda asks DE questions. Response by DE.  Comments and ruling by Court. Explanation of sentence to DE by Attorney Deda. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:56 am. 
Court imposes:

Ct. 1 - 10 year prison term consisting of (4 years initial confinement and 6 years of extended supervision), with credit for 1 day served.  Conditions: Court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; Register as sex offender; Comply with treatment plan as recommended; No contact with juveniles under age 18 except in a business or commercial setting or if it does not include overnight there can be contact provided the juvenile is in the presence of the juvenile's parent or guardian. No contact with the victims A.M.A., A.J.A. or A.F.A. unless in the presence of or consent of their mother while they are under age 18 and if they are 18 years of age or older the consent would be at their own discretion.

Ct. 2 - Sentence withheld - 8 years probation, concurrent with Ct. 3 and consecutive to Ct. 1. Conditions: Court costs and all other conditions as listed in Ct. 1.

Ct. 3 -  Sentence withheld - 8 years probation, concurrent with Ct. 2 and consecutive to Ct. 1. Conditions: Court costs and all other conditions as listed in Ct. 1.
copy to Deda and emailed copy to Tlusty 7/17/15.
see minutes on today's date under arraignment event

2:02 pm - Court calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Ron E Angelo appeared with attorney David Deda.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tlusty states that there is an agreement in place and that we move to plea and sentencing.  Tlusty states the agreement if nc/g pleas on all counts, a PSI will be ordered and the state will be bound by its findings.  Information received, acknowledged and waive its reading.  Deda files Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  DE enters plea of GUILTY to all counts.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire..  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  PSI ordered.  Bond to continue.  Off record at 2:11 pm.  Back on record at 2:13 pm.  Date of sentencing will be set for early August.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 9:15 am - Defendant Ron E Angelo appeared with attorney David Deda.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Deda provides court with waiver form.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Court finds waiver is given freely and voluntarily and accepts waiver.  Parties have received and reviewed information and waive reading.  Bond to continue.  To be set for arraignment. Adj. 9:17 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ron E Angelo
Current: W4481 S. Cherry Rd., Phillips, WI 54555 United States  (Effective: 11-25-2014)
Prior: W4481 S Cherry Rd., W4479 S Cherry Rd., Phillips, WI 54555 United States

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant, Ron E. Angelo, MAY HAVE NO CONTACT with juveniles under age 18 except in a business or commercial setting or if it does not include overnight there can be contact provided the juvenile is in the presence of the juvenile's parent or guardian or the Defendant, Ron E. Angelo, is in the presence of his brother, Don Angelo.  HOWEVER, CONTACT WITH THE VICTIMS A.M.A., A.J.A., AND A.F.A., CONTINUES TO BE PROHIBITED UNLESS ARRANGED BY OR CONSENTED TO BY PRICE COUNTY HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND THE VICTIMS' MOTHER.
Waiver of Prelim on December 10, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Ron E Angelo appeared with attorney David Deda.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin by telephone.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.
Request to seal probable cause affidavit and judicial determination, consent and order

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may have NO CONTACT with juveniles under age 18 except in a business or commercial setting or unless arranged by or consented to by Price County Human Services Department.
